name: Magic: The Gathering Phases and Steps

Beginning Phase.val: Untap creatures, lands, and artifacts you control that you want untapped.
Complete any actions or pay any costs that occur during upkeep.
Draw a card for the turn.

First Main Phase.val: Play spells or your one land allowance during this phase. Lasts until neither player wants to use a spell or ability (i.e. the stack is empty and neither player wants to do something).

Combat Phase.val: Play instants or activate abilities. Declare what player(s) will be attacked.
Declare which creatures will attack your opponent or opponent's planeswalker.
Opponents declare what creatures will be blocked and abilities/instants can be played in response.
Creatures deal damage to each other. An additional combat step is used for creatures with first or double strike.
Triggers occur and are dealt with before the phase officially ends.

Second Main Phase.val: Play spells or your one land allowance during this phase. Lasts until neither player wants to use a spell or ability (i.e. the stack is empty and neither player wants to do something).

End Phase.val: Reduce your hand to 7 cards or less, remove marked damage from all permanents, then pass the turn.
